intro: Tovomita martiana, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant typically has thick, fleshy leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. It is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care. Tovomita martiana prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive.
